param.name: docker_repo
param.label: Docker repository
param.help: Docker repository to start with docker run

param.name: use_gpus
param.label: Use GPUs?
param.help: Select Yes to run a CUDA application inside a container

param.name: partition_or_controller
param.label: Run service on partition or controller node?
param.help: Choose to run the service in the controller / login or partition / compute nodes

param.name: partition
param.label: Slurm partition with GPU support
param.help: Partition to submit the interactive job. Needs GPUs and CUDA!

param.name: walltime
param.help: e.g. 00:10:00 - Amount of time slurm will honor the interactive session.

param.name: numnodes
param.label: Number of nodes
param.help: Number of nodes to request for the interactive session.

param.name: exclusive
param.label: Exclusive
param.help: The job allocation can not share nodes with other running jobs

param.name: isession_clone_latest
param.label: Clone interactive_session repository?
param.help: Clone repository or use the local copy of the repository

param.name: isession_repo_url
param.label: URL of repository
param.help: This is passed to command: git clone --recurse-submodules

param.name: isession_repo_branch
param.label: Branch name
param.help: Name of the Github branch to check out: git checkout branch-name

param.name: stream
param.label: Stream slurm output?
param.help: Select Yes to stream the slurm output from the execution host to the job directory in PW

param.name: controller
param.label: Controller host
param.help: Use hostname@ip or a proxy like PoolName.clusters.pw. Use pw.conf to get PoolName from pw.conf

param.name: chdir
param.label: Working directory of the batch script
param.help: Working directory of the batch script to directory before it is executed

param.name: servicePort
param.label: Jupyter server port
param.help: Jupyter server port listening on the remote compute node
